documents.document: Not to mention there's always gonna be someone nearby for the private meetings for security reasons
Plus I have to imagine those guys gossip a lot amongst themselves because who else are they gonna vent/talk to
Purely from an access/fly on the wall standpoint, because they're the guys you don't think twice about
yaknow thinking about it, if that POTUS Staff Twitter account were legit Secret Service agents would actually be plausible people behind it
(At that point, western and central Canadian conservatives had common ground to want it dead for different reasons)
(the long gun registry didn't get SUPER controversial in Canada until it came out how much money was being spent on it)
Oh, and the gun registry money pit was ALSO going on at the time. Which is the real reason there was political capital to kill it
Granted the 90s were also a great time for the economy and Paul Martin was finance minister but it's still fascinating
And what still gets me is that even though Adscam happened on Chretien's watch, his govt STILL posted surpluses
But yeah; while the US Republicans have been all about a specific agenda the last several decades the Liberals are all about cribbing ideas
And what sunk the LIberals last time was the CPC unifying and the time-delayed cyanide capsule Chretien left for Paul Martin's govt
HOWEVER unlike the US Republicans they're anything but ideologically "pure" because the key to their success is a big tent strategy
Conversely the federal Liberals are sorta like the Republicans in the US in that there's a "we're the rightful ruling party" mindset to them
Several of those realists have now left federal politics, which makes one wonder.
The whole reason the CPC exists even was more a case of them having enough realists in the room who went "we need to unify to beat the Libs"
And ultimately both groups have different sets of priorities based on geography
You've got the more ideological western Conservatives, and the more centrist Red Tories who aren't that far off from the Liberals really
We haven't had a monolithic Conservative ideology in Canada since the Reform party split off; even under Harper there were factions
I'm not a Stephen Harper fan but I can still appreciate how hard his job was to keep the various Conservative factions under one tent.
I'm kinda wondering how O'Leary would do as well given he kinda has to keep the CPC united for two years. And that's not an easy task
@Suribot What is that from?
O'Leary is popular in the leadership race for kinda those same reasons.
A valid criticism of Trudeau is that he was kinda a celebrity candidate/frontman rather than a career politician
What I REALLY find puzzling re: the whole Kevin O'Leary candidacy for Conservative leadership is it undercuts some anti-Trudeau arguments
Curious if they'll make it an Arrow or Supergirl universe show now if so
Back in October, I had a parody idea I figured would be pointless once the election ended. But after the last two weeks it's still viable
Someone leak the original "Powerless" pilot online because I want to see how what could have been measures up to what we got
@DeadPigmon And the original trailer from last year is a COMPLETELY different product from what we ended up getting. Which is disappointing
@DeadPigmon Huh; I saw more positive stuff for the original pilot online. The current pilot is not good at all
Also, I'm just realizing that Kate Mucucci is nowhere to be found in the final show and WHAT THE HELL because she is entertaining
There's footage reused from the original trailer but WOW the tone is completely different from the original promo we got last year
And ah; this explains a lot; the original showrunner left. So the stuff they teased with last year is all from the ditched pilot
Also, I'm left wondering because half the promo footage that's out there wasn't in this episode even but in presumably a later one
It deserves another episode or two on the strength of the CONCEPT alone, despite the botched execution, but it'll need to impress me
I really want to see the original non-retooled pilot now because everyone was speaking pretty highly of that and this feels off the mark
Ultimately the tone the promo clips were going for is NOT the tone of the pilot and they kinda need to course correct this
But yeah; it's going for a more comedic tone with a dramatic score. And not an ironically used dramatic score, but one played straight
That's unsurprising mind given Tudyk's a talented and reliable performer who can bring whatever a show needs him to bring
Show takes itself too seriously when it should be having fun. Alan Tudyk's the best part of it because he gets the proper tone to go for
I think part of the problem though is that I was expecting something more akin to Better Off Ted and this show is nothing like that
Ironically it feels like it's a silly comedy idea being infected by the Serious elements of DC TV/film productions
The concept of the show has potential and the actors aren't bad but the tone they edited this thing for doesn't really work
Like, this is supposed to be a comedy but the score, for instance, doesn't actually fit the tone
Yeah; I think Powerless doesn't know what tone it's going for
@DeadPigmon @Suribot Oh, Phylla Vell. So much of a screwup that writers promptly forgot you exist after you died. (Unfortunately.)
Hmmmm. Halfway through ep 1 of Powerless and this is basically "the episode that didn't actually need to be made as it's the setup one"
https://t.co/PsTDGJIUXX *waits for Hasbro to cue the dump truck full of money again*
(The dub at a kid friendly time, the sub at a later time with a liquor license taken advantage of)
And even cooler, that theatre used it to announce they're gonna be doing monthly Studio Ghibli screenings, of both dub and subbed versions
Saw Princess Mononoke in theatres tonight in celebration of its 20th. Was the SECOND screening, to a packed house
@el_Ramses What I will say thankfully though is that he's written like Death's Head still and that would be EASY for people to get wrong
@el_Ramses It's even more boring in the Nova comic https://t.co/2MUn8YuleQ
@el_Ramses I don't mean the DHII design. I mean this https://t.co/fKr41ARMFR Tho at least Land gave him eyebrows; the guy on Nova doesn't.
@el_Ramses At least he's still being written properly, which is some consolation. But then that's because only people who care use him.
@el_Ramses But noooo we've gotta use the Greg Land redesign lousy as it is
@el_Ramses He's been used as recently as a few years ago too which is what bugs me. He was in a Spider-Man teamup book and that one-shot
@el_Ramses But yeah even in Marvel nowadays he's big. But with a crappy redesigned head that's less expressive and more robotic
@el_Ramses He's a big dude. Even after the 7th Doctor shrunk him down.
@el_Ramses Now what I'd LOVE is for them to do a proper Death's Head but a) he won't be in a wave w/ DHII b) he'd be the crap modern design
@el_Ramses Well if they did Ego he'd be Kurt Russell Ego, right? So that doesn't quite follow
@el_Ramses I want to know who the BAF is for GOTG wave 2 myself; I wonder if it's someone who's embargoed
@el_Ramses That'd make sense but I'm guessing they won't do one given half of them are Netflix characters

Ares sure is an odd choice though considering that he's what - a D-lister in Marvel? If it were DC I'd understand, but Marvel?
Kinda curious if that Marvel Knights Blade will be Wesley Snipes, or more comics-based
@Qlippot I hate that I have to take that seriously just in case
@JesseWittenrich *looks at the assortments* wait ANOTHER Enchantress? So soon? WTF and dammit Skurge is a BAF?
I hate that we're now in a place globally where if I'm offline for a few hours I have to check the news to see what the US did now
*sees a hashtag trending* ruh roh what did Minimus Manos do NOW
@aloadofhupla Same. Hoping I win tickets, much as my other alternate plans that night are good.
@TADspace Well sure. The whole age of 21 in the US is dumb too. It SHOULD be the enlistment age IMO.
@TADspace Ah. It’s kinda fascinating how much liquor laws vary by jurisdiction.
@TADspace Seriously? Wtf. Next they’ll want businesses closed and dress lengths mandated.
